title: Spotted at the Italian Open: The Color Combination That Adds at Least 3 Zeroes to Every Outfit
author: Eliza Huber
text: Some things are just true and shouldn't need to be explained repeatedly, one being the value-increasing qualities associated with wearing black with tan. Classic, elegant, and timeless, the color combination clicks every time, no matter what form it takes on or its actual cost. Of course, it helps when your black-and tan outfit is made up of a mix of Chanel, Cartier, and Celine (the big three); you're Lily Collins; and you're at the Italian Open. But even if none of those facts applies, trust me, wearing black with tan is the way to go if looking rich with zero effort is your goal.Collins wore the sophisticated shade duo over the weekend while attending the Italian Open in Rome alongside her husband, Charlie McDowell. Specifically, she chose a tweed jacket in a light shade of tan with gold hardware and paired it with a white T-shirt, black straight-leg cropped jeans, Celine Clea flat sandals, and a Chanel quilted black backpack. The Emily in Paris star and Cartier ambassador finished off the classy ensemble with a pair of wire-rim sunglasses from the French jewelry house.(Image credit: Backgrid)On Lily Collins: Celine shoes; Chanel bag; Cartier Panthère de Cartier Sunglasses ($1445)But Collins isn't the only elegant dresser who leans on the tan and black pieces in their closet. Some of the best looks on Instagram this year have been colored in the neutral-shade duo, including 'fits on Jasmine Tookes, Sylvie Mus, and more. A Burberry trench paired with black jeans? Check! Khaki pants paired with a tailored blazer? Check! The possibilities really are endless. The best part? No matter how you style tan with black, it'll always look expensive.More tan-and-black outfit inspiration:Scroll down to shop some of the richest-looking tan and black pieces, from Kallmeyer's viral Tavi trench coat to the black jeans every WWW editor owns and loves.Shop the rich-looking tan-and-black color combination: KALLMEYER Tavi Pleated Cotton-Blend Twill Trench Coat I think about this trench coat at least once a week. NEOUS Diwo Bow-Embellished Patent-Leather Slingback Sandals The perfect barely there strappy sandals. The Row Anitas Dress in Wool This is a sculptural masterpiece. YSL Midnight Small Clutch in Smooth Leather in Black A great formal clutch is a wardrobe item everyone should own. LE KASHA Sawadah Linen Vest The fit on this vest is delicious. HIGH SPORT Julep Stretch-Cotton Straight-Leg Pants Oh yes, the beloved High Sport pants also come in tan. The Row Marlo 12 Bag in Leather This bag is at the tippy top of my wish list. COS Asymmetric Double-Faced Wool Top Michael Kors Collection Stretch Cotton City Shorts Bermuda shorts are the bottoms of the summer. prada Washed Twill Minidress with Safety Pin The gold safety pin only adds to this classic LBD's appeal. YSL Cassandra Wedges in Smooth Leather in Noir The little gold YSL hardware is so minimal and chic. KHAITE Saraphina Leather Jacket The Row Alfidis Pant in Cotton and Cashmere Bottega Veneta Orbit Flash Sneaker LIBEROWE Ruffled Cashmere Peplum Cardigan The feeling of this cashmere is next-level. prada Buckle Small Leather Handbag with Belt All of the top fashion editors are carrying this bag. Marni Bonded Poplin A-Line Dress This dress is both delicate and edgy. NILI LOTAN Patti Wool-Twill Jacket This jacket with khakis and a white T-shirt? Done. Citizens of Humanity Zurie High Waist Straight Leg Jeans WWW's associate director of special projects, Kristen Nichols, and I both own these and rave about them. Burberry Check Mews High Mules​ in Alabaster COS Collared Suede Jacket I've been eyeing this suede jacket for weeks—months even. Eliza Huber is an NYC-based senior fashion editor who specializes in trend reporting, brand discovery, and the intersection of sports and fashion. She joined Who What Wear in 2021 from Refinery29, the job she took after graduating with a business degree from the University of Iowa. She's launched two columns, Let's Get a Room and Ways to Wear; profiled Dakota Fanning, Diane Kruger, Katie Holmes, Gracie Abrams, and Sabrina Carpenter; and reported on everything from the relationship between Formula One and fashion to the top runway trends each season. Eliza lives on the Upper West Side and spends her free time researching F1 fashion imagery for her side Instagram accounts @thepinnacleoffashion and @f1paddockfits, watching WNBA games, and scouring The RealReal for discounted Prada.
html:
Some things are just true and shouldn't need to be explained repeatedly, one being the value-increasing qualities associated with wearing black with tan. Classic, elegant, and timeless, the color combination clicks every time, no matter what form it takes on or its actual cost. Of course, it helps when your black-and tan outfit is made up of a mix of Chanel, Cartier, and Celine (the big three); you're Lily Collins; and you're at the Italian Open. But even if none of those facts applies, trust me, wearing black with tan is the way to go if looking rich with zero effort is your goal.

Collins wore the sophisticated shade duo over the weekend while attending the Italian Open in Rome alongside her husband, Charlie McDowell. Specifically, she chose a tweed jacket in a light shade of tan with gold hardware and paired it with a white T-shirt, black straight-leg cropped jeans, Celine Clea flat sandals, and a Chanel quilted black backpack. The Emily in Paris star and Cartier ambassador finished off the classy ensemble with a pair of wire-rim sunglasses from the French jewelry house.

On Lily Collins: Celine shoes; Chanel bag; Cartier Panthère de Cartier Sunglasses ($1445)

But Collins isn't the only elegant dresser who leans on the tan and black pieces in their closet. Some of the best looks on Instagram this year have been colored in the neutral-shade duo, including 'fits on Jasmine Tookes, Sylvie Mus, and more. A Burberry trench paired with black jeans? Check! Khaki pants paired with a tailored blazer? Check! The possibilities really are endless. The best part? No matter how you style tan with black, it'll always look expensive.

More tan-and-black outfit inspiration:

Scroll down to shop some of the richest-looking tan and black pieces, from Kallmeyer's viral Tavi trench coat to the black jeans every WWW editor owns and loves.

Shop the rich-looking tan-and-black color combination:

KALLMEYER

Tavi Pleated Cotton-Blend Twill Trench Coat

I think about this trench coat at least once a week.

NEOUS

Diwo Bow-Embellished Patent-Leather Slingback Sandals

The perfect barely there strappy sandals.

The Row

Anitas Dress in Wool

This is a sculptural masterpiece.

YSL

Midnight Small Clutch in Smooth Leather in Black

A great formal clutch is a wardrobe item everyone should own.

LE KASHA

Sawadah Linen Vest

The fit on this vest is delicious.

HIGH SPORT

Julep Stretch-Cotton Straight-Leg Pants

Oh yes, the beloved High Sport pants also come in tan.

The Row

Marlo 12 Bag in Leather

This bag is at the tippy top of my wish list.

COS

Asymmetric Double-Faced Wool Top

Michael Kors Collection

Stretch Cotton City Shorts

Bermuda shorts are the bottoms of the summer.

prada

Washed Twill Minidress with Safety Pin

The gold safety pin only adds to this classic LBD's appeal.

YSL

Cassandra Wedges in Smooth Leather in Noir

The little gold YSL hardware is so minimal and chic.

KHAITE

Saraphina Leather Jacket

Buckle Small Leather Handbag with Belt

Bonded Poplin A-Line Dress

This dress is both delicate and edgy.

NILI LOTAN

Patti Wool-Twill Jacket

This jacket with khakis and a white T-shirt? Done.

Citizens of Humanity

Zurie High Waist Straight Leg Jeans

WWW's associate director of special projects, Kristen Nichols, and I both own these and rave about them.

Burberry

Check Mews High Mules​ in Alabaster

COS

Collared Suede Jacket

I've been eyeing this suede jacket for weeks—months even.

Eliza Huber is an NYC-based senior fashion editor who specializes in trend reporting, brand discovery, and the intersection of sports and fashion. She joined Who What Wear in 2021 from Refinery29, the job she took after graduating with a business degree from the University of Iowa. She's launched two columns, Let's Get a Room and Ways to Wear; profiled Dakota Fanning, Diane Kruger, Katie Holmes, Gracie Abrams, and Sabrina Carpenter; and reported on everything from the relationship between Formula One and fashion to the top runway trends each season. Eliza lives on the Upper West Side and spends her free time researching F1 fashion imagery for her side Instagram accounts @thepinnacleoffashion and @f1paddockfits, watching WNBA games, and scouring The RealReal for discounted Prada.
